lines.text: Mrs. King, I happen to dislike all children intensely. But I can assure you that I can readily attend to their necessary though unpleasant wants.
I am, in my way, a philosopher.
Oh, I see, you just sit and think.
Mr. King, if more people just sat and thought, the world might not be in the stinking mess that it is.
Mrs. King, as I told you last night, I dislike children intensely and yours, if I may say so, have peculiarly repulsive habits and manners.
You know, Mrs. King, it's really all your fault.
If you weren't so darned pretty, we wouldn't have so many kids for people to sit with.
Intoxication is a form of escape often sought by the mentally immature.
Mr. Belvedere, is there anything you haven't been?
Yes, Mrs. King - I've never been an idler or a parasite.
